author: Gof
message: Do you think KDialog::setMainWidget should call itself widget->layout()->setMargin(0) ?

author: Aurélien
message:
@Gof: I guess it would be a more definitive fix, yes. I thought about it, but it would be wrong if someone does not want his particular dialog content layout to be fixed.
I guess this could be addressed by changing setMainWidget() signature like this:
setMainWidget(QWidget*, KDialog::LayoutMarginHandling = ResetLayoutMargin)

where LayoutMarginHandling would be an enum with two values:
ResetLayoutMargin and KeepLayoutMargin.

Something similar should be done for KConfigDialog too.

author: Riccardo Iaconelli
message:
I still prefer it the other way around :P
I think it separates more the "fixed" elements from the "variable" content. Nothing very important though. ;-)

author: Aurélien
message:
@Gof: It turns out this solution is not perfect, because some applications create their dialog content by calling mainWidget(), which instantiate a QWidget if none is set and call setMainWidget(). In this case, no layout is set on the widget at the time setMainWidget() is called, so it doesn't work.

@Riccardo: If you want to separate the "fixed" elements, it's much nicer to call showButtonSeparator(true) on your dialog.
